title: Which is the right word in the blank space in the sentence, 'They are not (my or mine) friends'? - Quora

response.answer_text: The right word is ‘my' and the sentence will read as follows: ‘They are not my friends.’ Now, have a look at the following example with the usage of mine in effect. A: Hey, is he your friend? B: No, he is not my friend. We were friends earlier but not anymore. A: Oh…I'm sorry to hear that. What happened? You were good friends right? B: He stole something valuable of mine. My friends don't steal from me.
The right word in the blank will be “They are not my friends”?use 'my'; the word ‘mine' can be used in a sentence ,for example :- “These shoes are not mine”. Thank you.
